events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway, requesting to file a claim for damages sustained to their vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the description involving a vehicle collision on a busy road.
An agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer and oversee the claim process related to the reported auto accident.
The customer was formally acknowledged that their claim has been received and is now being processed for their car accident.
The customer was asked to provide a police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and insurance information for further evaluation.
All requested documents including accident photos and police report were submitted by the customer within the expected timeframe.
The claims team began their investigation into the vehicle collision to verify damages and liability as per policy terms.
Investigation was completed successfully confirming the extent of damage and validating the claim under the auto policy.
A settlement proposal was provided to the customer covering the repairs for the car damage with a detailed cost estimate.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the handling of their claim.
The claim was officially approved by the insurer following acceptance of the settlement terms by the claimant.
Payment for the approved settlement was issued promptly to the customer to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
The claim was closed after confirmation that the payment was received and the vehicle repairs were completed satisfactorily.
The entire case file was archived in the system for future reference and policy record keeping following successful closure.
